lead_paragraph: The program was a quadruple bill of French-accented pieces, including “Sonatine,” “Walpurgisnacht Ballet,” “Symphony in C” and “La Valse.”

headline.print_headline: Serving 4 Helpings of Balanchine, With Thunderbolts and Tornadoes
headline.main: Review: Serving 4 Helpings of Balanchine, With Thunderbolts and Tornadoes

snippet: The program was a quadruple bill of French-accented pieces, including “Sonatine,” “Walpurgisnacht Ballet,” “Symphony in C” and “La Valse.”
abstract: Alastair Macaulay reviews New York City Ballet performance of four Balanchine works, including Sonatine, which has not been in repertory since 2004, and Walpurgisnacht Ballet with Alexa Maxwell in her soloist debut, at David H Koch Theater.
